item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Michio Kaku
item.description: "...the "Mind of God," which Einstein wrote eloquently about, is cosmic music resonating throughout hyperspace." -- Michio Kaku

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "To elevate the soul, poetry is necessary." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Enya
item.description: "Long, long journey through the darkness Long, long way to go But what are miles across the ocean To the heart that's coming home?" -- Enya

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Thomas Moore
item.description: "Though the last glimpse of Erin with sorrow I see, Yet wherever thou art shall seem Erin to me; In exile thy bosom shall still be my home, And thine eyes make my climate wherever we roam." -- Thomas Moore

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious - the fundamental emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Deep thinking is attainable only by a man of deep feeling, and all truth is a species of revelation" -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Frank Harte
item.description: "Those in power write the history, while those who suffer write the songs." -- Frank Harte

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Sigurd F. Olson
item.description: "Joys come from simple and natural things; mist over meadows, sunlight on leaves, the path of the moon over water. Even rain and wind and stormy clouds bring joy." -- Sigurd F. Olson

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Irish poets, learn your trade, sing whatever is well made, scorn the sort now growing up all out of shape from toe to top." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "People will not look forward to posterity who never look backward to their ancestors." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Seamus Heaney
item.description: "I can't think of a case where poems changed the world, but what they do is they change people's understanding of what's going on in the world." -- Seamus Heaney

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We can have in life but one great experience at best, and the secret of life is to reproduce that experience as often as possible." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
<i>[Thanksgiving Day Proclamation, 1963]</i>" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Liam O'Flaherty
item.description: "It's impossible for a creative artist to be either a Puritan or a Fascist, because both are a negation of the creative urge. The only things a creative artist can be opposed to are ugliness and injustice." -- Liam O'Flaherty

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Sean O'Casey
item.description: "Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living." -- Sean O'Casey

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "Vision is the art of seeing things invisible." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Happiness is like a butterfly which, when pursued, is always beyond our grasp, but, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "Nature never did betray The heart that loved her." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Edna O'Brien
item.description: "When anyone asks me about the Irish character, I say look at the trees. Maimed, stark and misshapen, but ferociously tenacious." -- Edna O'Brien

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall." -- Confucius

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by John O'Donohue
item.description: "When you steal a people's language, you leave their soul bewildered." -- John O'Donohue

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Chögyam Trungpa
item.description: "Enlightenment is ego's ultimate disappointment." -- Chögyam Trungpa

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "Greed is an imperfection that defiles the mind; hate is an imperfection that defiles the mind; delusion is an imperfection that defiles the mind." -- Buddha

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Dhammapada
item.description: "Fools, their wisdom weak, are their own enemies as they go through life, doing evil that bears bitter fruit." -- Dhammapada

item.title: Chrissy add a quote by Grover Cleveland
item.description: "We will not forget that Liberty has here made her home; nor shall her chosen altar be neglected." -- Grover Cleveland
